message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide unit of collagen is Glycine (Gly) followed by X and Y amino acids. The most common X and Y amino acids are proline (Pro) and hydroxyproline (Hyp). Thus, the correct answer is (C) Gly-X-Y.

We refer to biologic textbooks for help. The basic repeating tripeptide in collagen is Gly-X-Y, with X usually being proline and Y usually being hydroxyproline. This tripeptide sequence allows for the tight packing and stabilization of collagen fibers.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Gly-X-Y, where X and Y are any amino acids but are usually proline and hydroxyproline, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on collagen for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Glycine-X-Y, where X is often proline and Y is often hydroxyproline. This repeating sequence allows collagen to form a unique triple helix structure.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Glycine-X-Y, where X and Y may be any amino acid but most commonly are proline and hydroxyproline.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Gly-X-Y, where X and Y are often proline and hydroxyproline.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Glycine-X-Y, where X and Y represent any amino acid. This sequence gives collagen its characteristic triple-helical structure.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Glycine-X-Y. X is often Proline and Y is often Hydroxyproline.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Gly-X-Y, where X and Y are usually proline or hydroxyproline.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The basic repeating tripeptide of collagen is Gly-X-Y, with X and Y being various amino acids. Serine, Methionine, and Glutamic acid are not commonly found in the repeating tripeptide of collagen.
